content.webTitle: Aston Villa v Manchester United: match preview

fields.headline: Aston Villa v Manchester United: match preview
fields.bodyText: Manchester United will travel to Aston Villa in high spirits having won their previous six league games. While Paul Lambert has steadied the Villa team since a six-game losing streak, his side will have to improve to have any chance of a positive result. However Christian Benteke could provide them with a glimmer of hope when challenging the perpetually weakened United defence. Graham Searles Kick-off Saturday 3pm Venue Villa Park Last season Aston Villa 0 Manchester United 3 Referee L Mason This season G11, Y29, R3, 2.9 cards per game Odds H 11-2 A 4-6 D 31-10 Aston Villa Subs from Given, Vlaar, Bacuna, Herd, Stevens, Robinson, Burke, Grealish Doubtful None Injured Baker (knee, unknown), Cole (hamstring, 26 Dec), Kozak (leg, unknown), Westwood (knee, Jan) Suspended Cleverley, Hutton (both one match), Richardson (first of three) Form DDDWWL Discipline Y34 R2 Leading scorer Agbonlahor, Weimann 3 Manchester United Subs from Lindegaard, Anderson,Di María, Lingard, Januzaj, Blackett, Da Silva, Wilson, Herrera, Amos, McNair, Janko, Pereira, Thorpe Doubtful Di María, Lingard (match fitness) Injured Blind (knee, Jan), Fellaini (ill, 26 Dec), Rojo (thigh, Jan), Shaw (ankle, Jan), Smalling (calf, Jan) Suspended None Form WWWWWW Discipline Y31 R3 Leading scorer Van Persie 7
